alert.note: Alert for Elk; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:06AM CDT until June 01 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ELK...WILSON...NEOSHO...WOODSON AND ALLEN COUNTIES... At 1205 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Kincaid to 6 miles north of Erie to near Fredonia, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Neodesha, Fredonia, Humboldt, Yates Center, Erie, St. Paul, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Thayer, Altoona, Buffalo, Neosho Falls, Galesburg, Savonburg, Elsmore, Benedict and Stark. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
